text:
From: Peter, an apostle of Jesus, the Messiah.
To: The exiles of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the people chosen according to the foreknowledge of God the Father through the sanctifying action of the Spirit to be obedient to Jesus, the Messiah, and to be sprinkled with his blood.
May grace and peace be yours in abundance!
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah! Because of his great mercy he has granted us a new birth, resulting in an immortal hope through the resurrection of Jesus, the Messiah, from the dead
speaker: Narrator

text: and to an inheritance kept in heaven for you that can’t be destroyed, corrupted, or changed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through faith you are being protected by God’s power for a salvation that is ready to be revealed at the end of this era.
speaker: Narrator

text: You greatly rejoice in this, even though you have to suffer various kinds of trials for a little while,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that your genuine faith, which is more valuable than gold that perishes when tested by fire, may result in praise, glory, and honor when Jesus, the Messiah, is revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though you have not seen him, you love him. And even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and rejoice with an indescribable and glorious joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: because you are receiving the goal of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the prophets, who prophesied about the grace that was to be yours, carefully researched and investigated this salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tried to find out what era or specific time the Spirit of the Messiah in them kept referring to when he predicted the sufferings of the Messiah and the glories that would follow.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was revealed to them that they were not serving themselves but you in regard to the things that have now been announced to you by those who brought you the good news through the Holy Spirit sent from heaven. These are things that even the angels desire to look into.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, prepare your minds for action, keep a clear head, and set your hope completely on the grace to be given you when Jesus, the Messiah, is revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: As obedient children, do not be shaped by the desires that used to influence you when you were ignorant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, be holy in every aspect of your life, just as the one who called you is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written, “You must be holy, because I am holy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: If you call “Father” the one who judges everyone impartially according to what they have done, you must live in reverent fear as long as you are strangers in a strange land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you know that it was not with perishable things like silver or gold that you have been ransomed from the worthless way of life handed down to you by your ancestors,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with the precious blood of the Messiah, like that of a lamb without blemish or defect.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the one hand, he was foreknown before the creation of the world, but on the other hand, he was revealed at the end of time for your sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through him you believe in God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your faith and hope might be in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now that you have obeyed the truth and have purified your souls to love your brothers sincerely, you must love one another intensely and with a pure heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have been born again, not by a seed that perishes but by one that cannot perish—by the living and everlasting word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For
“All human life is like grass,
    and all its glory is like a flower in the grass.
The grass dries up and the flower drops off,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but the word of the Lord lasts forever.”
Now this word is the good news that was announced to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, rid yourselves of every kind of evil and deception, hypocrisy, jealousy, and every kind of slander.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like newborn babies, thirst for the pure milk of the word so that by it you may grow in your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely you have tasted that the Lord is good!
speaker: Narrator

text: As you come to him, the living stone who was rejected by people but was chosen and precious in God’s sight,
speaker: Narrator

text: you, too, as living stones, are building yourselves up into a spiritual house and a holy priesthood, so that you may offer spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God through Jesus, the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is why it says in Scripture:
“Look! I am laying a chosen, precious cornerstone in Zion.
    The one who believes in him will never be ashamed.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he is precious to you who believe, but to those who do not believe,
“The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone,
speaker: Narrator

text:
a stone they stumble over
    and a rock they trip on.”
They keep on stumbling because they disobey the word, as they were destined to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people to be his very own and to proclaim the wonderful deeds of the one who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Once you were not a people,
    but now you are the people of God.
Once you had not received mercy,
    but now you have received mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dear friends, I urge you as aliens and exiles to keep on abstaining from the desires of the flesh that wage war against the soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Continue to live such upright lives among the gentiles that, when they slander you as practicers of evil, they may see your good actions and glorify God when he visits them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord’s sake submit yourselves to every human authority: whether to the king as supreme,
speaker: Narrator

text: or to governors who are sent by him to punish those who do wrong and to praise those who do right.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is God’s will that by doing right you should silence the ignorant talk of foolish people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Live like free people, and do not use your freedom as an excuse for doing evil. Instead, be God’s servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor everyone. Keep on loving the community of believers, fearing God, and honoring the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: You household servants must submit yourselves to your masters out of respect, not only to those who are kind and fair, but also to those who are unjust.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is a fine thing if, when moved by your conscience to please God, you suffer patiently when wronged.
speaker: Narrator

text: What good does it do if, when you sin, you patiently receive punishment for it? But if you suffer for doing good and receive it patiently, you have God’s approval.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is, in fact, what you were called to do, because:
The Messiah also suffered for you
    and left an example for you
        to follow in his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He never sinned,
    and he never told a lie.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he was insulted,
    he did not retaliate.
When he suffered,
    he did not threaten.
It was his habit
    to commit the matter to the one who judges fairly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He himself bore our sins” in his body on the tree,
    so that we might die to those sins
        and live righteously.
“By his wounds
    you have been healed.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You were “like sheep that kept going astray,”
    but now you have returned to the shepherd
        and overseer of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a similar way, you wives must submit yourselves to your husbands so that, even if some of them refuse to obey the word, they may be won over without a word through your conduct as wives
speaker: Narrator

text: when they see your pure and reverent lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your beauty should not be an external one, consisting of braided hair or the wearing of gold ornaments and dresses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, it should be the inner disposition of the heart, consisting in the imperishable quality of a gentle and quiet spirit, which God values greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, this is how holy women who set their hope on God used to make themselves beautiful in the past. They submitted themselves to their husbands,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as Sarah obeyed Abraham and called him lord. You have become her daughters by doing good and by not letting anything terrify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a similar way, you husbands must live with your wives in an understanding manner, as with a most delicate partner. Honor them as heirs with you of the gracious gift of life, so that nothing may interfere with your prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, all of you must live in harmony, be sympathetic, love as brothers, and be compassionate and humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not pay others back evil for evil or insult for insult. Instead, keep blessing them, because you were called to inherit a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For the person who wants to love life
    and see good days
must keep his tongue from evil
    and his lips from speaking deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He must turn away from evil and do good.
    He must seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord watches the righteous,
    and he pays attention to their prayers.
But the Lord opposes those who do wrong.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will harm you if you are devoted to doing what is good?
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if you should suffer for doing what is right, you are blessed. “Never be afraid of their threats, and never get upset.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, exalt the Messiah” as Lord in your lives. Always be prepared to give a defense to everyone who asks you to explain the hope you have.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do this gently and respectfully, keeping a clear conscience, so that those who speak evil of your good conduct in the Messiah will be ashamed of slandering you.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, if it is the will of God, it is better to suffer for doing right than for doing wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Messiah also suffered for sins once for all,
    an innocent person for the guilty,
        so that he could bring you to God.
He was put to death in a mortal body
    but was brought to life by the Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: in which he went and made a proclamation to those imprisoned spirits
speaker: Narrator

text: who disobeyed long ago in the days of Noah, when God waited patiently while the ark was being built. In it a few, that is, eight persons, were saved by water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Baptism, which is symbolized by that water, now saves you also, not by removing dirt from the body, but by asking God for a clear conscience based on the resurrection of Jesus, the Messiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who has gone to heaven and is at the right hand of God, where angels, authorities, and powers have been made subject to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since the Messiah suffered in a mortal body, you, too, must arm yourselves with the same determination, because the person who has suffered in a mortal body has stopped sinning,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that he can live the rest of his mortal life guided, not by human desires, but by the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you spent enough time in the past doing what the gentiles like to do, living in sensuality, sinful desires, drunkenness, wild celebrations, drinking parties, and detestable idolatry.
speaker: Narrator

text: They insult you now because they are surprised that you are no longer joining them in the same excesses of wild living.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will give an account to the one who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, this is why the gospel was proclaimed even to those who have died, so that they could be judged in their mortal flesh like all humans and live in the spiritual realm like God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because everything will soon come to an end, be sensible and clear-headed, so you can pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all, continue to love each other deeply, because love covers a multitude of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show hospitality to one another without complaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: As good servant managers of God’s grace in its various forms, serve one another with the gift each of you has received.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks must speak God’s words. Whoever serves must serve with the strength that God supplies, so that in every way God may be glorified through Jesus, the Messiah. Glory and power belong to him forever and ever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dear friends, do not be surprised by the fiery ordeal that is taking place among you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, because you are participating in the sufferings of the Messiah, keep on rejoicing, so that you may be glad and shout for joy when his glory is revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are insulted because of the name of the Messiah, you are blessed, for the glorious Spirit of God is resting on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of course, none of you should suffer for being a murderer, thief, criminal, or troublemaker.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you suffer for being a Christian, do not feel ashamed, but glorify God with that name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time has come for judgment to begin with the household of God. And if it begins with us, what will be the outcome for those who refuse to obey the gospel of God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If it is hard for the righteous person to be saved,
    what will happen to the ungodly and sinful person?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, those who suffer according to God’s will should entrust their souls to their faithful Creator and continue to do what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, as a fellow elder, a witness of the Messiah’s sufferings, and one who shares in the glory to be revealed, I appeal to the elders among you:
speaker: Narrator

text: Be shepherds of God’s flock that is among you, watching over it, not because you must but because you want to, and not greedily but eagerly, as God desires.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lord it over the people entrusted to you, but be examples to the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, when the Chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the victor’s crown of glory that will never fade away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In a similar way, you young people must submit to the elders. All of you must clothe yourselves with humility for the sake of each other, because:
“God opposes the arrogant,
    but gives grace to the humble.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, so that at the proper time he may exalt you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Throw all your worry on him, because he cares for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be clear-minded and alert. Your opponent, the Devil, is prowling around like a roaring lion, looking for someone to devour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Resist him and be firm in the faith, because you know that your brothers throughout the world are undergoing the same kinds of suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: After you have suffered for a little while, the God of all grace, who called you by the Messiah Jesus to his eternal glory, will restore you, establish you, strengthen you, and support you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Power belongs to him forever and ever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through Silvanus, whom I regard as a faithful brother, I have written this short letter to encourage you and to testify that this is to be the true grace of God in which you are to stand firm!
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sister church in Babylon, chosen along with you, sends you greetings, as does Mark, whom I regard as a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet one another with a loving kiss. Peace be to all of you who are in the Messiah!
speaker: Narrator
